column1: Organized by Module > Sub-Group | Total Parameters: 378

column3: Parameter Detail
Check cylinder hydro-test date stamp; must be within 3-year validity period
Verify RTO-approved CNG fitment certificate with matching chassis number
Apply soapy water on CNG joints and fittings; watch for bubbles indicating gas leak
Inspect pressure regulator for cracks, corrosion and leaks; verify proper pressure output
Visually inspect CNG cylinder for dents, corrosion, scuff marks and expiry date stamp
Check cylinder mounting brackets and straps for tightness and structural integrity
Operate shut-off valve on/off; verify it completely stops gas flow when closed
Inspect gas injector rail for leaks, corrosion and proper seating on manifold
Parameter Detail
Start engine from cold; observe cranking effort, idle stability and initial vibrations
Remove oil filler cap on running engine; check for excessive pressure or vapor blowback
Listen for irregular firing pattern at idle and under load; note any stumbling or hesitation
Feel engine area for abnormal vibration at idle and when revving; compare with typical levels
Smell exhaust output for unusual odors such as raw fuel, burning oil or sweet coolant
Observe exhaust under acceleration; black smoke indicates rich fuel mixture or injector issue
Observe exhaust at startup and revving; blue smoke indicates engine is burning oil
Observe exhaust at operating temperature; persistent white smoke may indicate coolant leak into combustion
Check for milky oil on dipstick, bubbles in coolant reservoir, white exhaust and overheating pattern
Observe tachometer at idle for 2 minutes; RPM should hold steady without hunting or fluctuation
Inspect intercooler pipes and core for damage, boost leaks and clogged or bent fins
Listen for deep metallic knocking sound from lower engine at idle and under load
Check for coolant stains, warped components, blown hoses or erratic temperature gauge behavior
Inspect radiator core for bent fins, cracks, leaks, corrosion and dried coolant stains
Run engine to operating temperature; verify cooling fan engages automatically and spins freely
Listen for light rhythmic tapping from valve train area (top of engine) at idle
Press accelerator progressively; engine RPM should rise immediately without lag or hesitation
Listen for metallic rattling or whining from front of engine especially during cold start
Listen for turbo spool-up sound under acceleration; check turbo shaft for play and oil leaks at seals
Restart engine when fully warm; should catch immediately and settle to smooth idle
Parameter Detail
Connect OBD scanner; read ABS module for active and stored fault codes
Connect OBD scanner; read SRS/airbag module for deployment history and stored fault codes
Perform compression test across all cylinders; compare readings for consistency (max 10% variation)
Check for aftermarket ECU tuning chips, piggyback modules or evidence of software remapping
Connect OBD scanner; read emission system for catalytic converter and O2 sensor fault codes
Connect OBD scanner; read and document all currently active diagnostic trouble codes (DTCs)
Read stored and pending codes from OBD history; note if codes have been recently cleared
Parameter Detail
Check AdBlue/DEF tank level on dashboard or visually; inspect filler cap and supply hoses
Listen for even injector ticking pattern with engine running; check for fuel leaks around rail
Check DPF warning light history on dashboard; inspect exhaust for excessive soot buildup
Inspect EGR valve and passages for heavy carbon buildup; check valve movement and sealing
Inspect fuel water separator bowl for water accumulation; test drain valve operation
Turn ignition ON without starting; glow plug indicator should illuminate then extinguish within seconds
Parameter Detail
Test 12V auxiliary battery voltage and health using multimeter or electronic battery tester
Check battery cooling fan operation; verify coolant flow through HV battery thermal management circuit
Inspect EV charging port for bent pins, corrosion, cracks, water ingress or physical damage
Connect DC fast charger; verify charging session initiates and power delivery matches expected rate
Listen for unusual whining, grinding or clicking sounds from electric drive motor area
Feel for abnormal vibration from electric motor area during acceleration and deceleration
Read HV battery State of Health percentage from vehicle diagnostics screen or OBD scanner
Visually trace orange HV cables for insulation damage, chafing, abrasion or exposed conductors
Connect AC Level 1/2 charger; verify charging session starts and power draw is within specification
Lift off accelerator while driving; regenerative braking should decelerate smoothly and consistently
Monitor battery thermal management during driving; heating and cooling should activate as needed
Parameter Detail
Draw brake fluid sample from reservoir cap; check for dark discoloration, debris or moisture contamination
Visually check brake fluid reservoir level against MIN and MAX markings on reservoir
Open coolant reservoir cap when cold; inspect coolant color against expected type for the vehicle
Check coolant expansion tank level against MIN and MAX markings when engine is cold
Inspect oil filler cap underside and dipstick for milky white residue; check coolant for oil film
Pull dipstick and inspect oil color and consistency; rub between fingers to check for grit
Examine dipstick oil for metal flakes, coolant traces (milky) or fuel dilution (thin/smells of petrol)
Inspect underside of engine block, oil pan and bottom gaskets for oil drips or wet spots
Inspect valve cover gasket, cam cover and upper engine gaskets for oil seepage or wet stains
Pull dipstick; verify engine oil level sits between MIN and MAX indicator marks
Inspect dipstick tip and oil filler cap interior for metallic shimmer or visible metal particles
Remove oil filler cap; shine torch inside valve cover to check for sludge deposits on surfaces
Check power steering fluid reservoir level against MIN and MAX markings; note fluid color
Pull transmission dipstick (if accessible); smell fluid for burnt odor indicating overheated clutch packs
Check transmission dipstick with engine warm and running in Park (auto) or cold (manual); note level and color
Parameter Detail
Remove air filter element from housing; inspect for dirt loading, debris, tears or oil contamination
Inspect both battery terminals and cable clamps for white or green corrosion buildup
Inspect serpentine and accessory drive belts for cracks, fraying, glazing, chunk missing or looseness
Have assistant rev engine in Drive with brake held; watch engine mounts for excessive rocking movement
Inspect entire exhaust system: pipes, joints, muffler, catalytic converter for rust, holes and loose hangers
With engine running, listen near fuel injector rail for even rhythmic clicking across all injectors
Turn ignition to ON position without starting; listen for fuel pump priming hum from fuel tank area
Inspect all rubber coolant, vacuum and fuel hoses for cracks, bulging, hardening or leaks at clamps
Remove PCV valve and shake; should rattle freely. If stuck or silent, valve is clogged
With engine idling, listen around intake manifold and vacuum hoses for hissing indicating air leak
Inspect all visible wiring looms in engine bay and cabin for rodent chew marks, exposed copper or nesting material
Parameter Detail
Test drive on loose gravel or wet surface; verify AWD/4WD engages and all wheels receive power
Lift wheel off ground; grab at 6 and 12 o'clock and rock to feel for play in axle shaft
Inspect inner and outer CV joint rubber boots on both sides for cracks, splits or grease leaks
Turn steering to full lock both sides while driving slowly; listen for repetitive clicking sound
Drive at 40-60 km/h and coast; listen for whining, humming or clunking from differential area
Visually inspect driveshaft for bends or dents; check universal joints for play by hand
Accelerate through 20-80 km/h range; feel for vibration transmitted through floor from drivetrain
Inspect transmission and drivetrain rubber mount bushes for visible cracking, perishing or sagging
Inspect propeller shaft for dents, surface rust and worn universal joint bearings
Inspect transfer case housing and output seals for oil seepage, wet spots or active drips
Parameter Detail
Drive in normal mode; automatic shifts between gears should be smooth and prompt without noticeable delay
Press and slowly release clutch pedal; note the engagement (bite) point in pedal travel range
Press clutch pedal to floor and release; check for smooth travel, consistent resistance and full spring return
Accelerate hard in high gear (4th/5th) at low RPM; if RPM rises without matching speed gain, clutch is slipping
Accelerate steadily in CVT vehicle; listen for unusual whining, droning or belt-slipping noise from transmission
Drive in stop-and-go traffic at low speed; check for jerking or shuddering during 1st-2nd gear transitions
Shift through all gears sequentially; each gear should slot in cleanly without resistance or notchiness
Shift between gears deliberately; any grinding or crunching sound indicates worn synchronizers
Move gear selector through all positions (P-R-N-D or 1-2-3-4-5-R); each should feel positive and click into place
Drive under varying load conditions; gear should hold engagement without popping out unexpectedly
Drive in each gear and listen; whining, rumbling or growling from gearbox area indicates bearing wear
Stop on moderate incline; release brake pedal fully and check if hill-hold engages before rolling back
With engine off, move gear lever in all directions from neutral; excessive slop indicates worn linkage bushes
With engine running and gearbox in neutral, listen for whining or rattling that stops when clutch is pressed
On slight incline, shift to Park and release brake; vehicle should hold firmly without clunking or rolling
From neutral, engage reverse gear; should slot in cleanly without grinding noise or resistance
With engine idling, shift from Neutral to Drive; engagement should be prompt and smooth without harsh thud
Inspect underneath the transmission casing and around output seals for fluid drips or wet patches
Inspect transmission mount rubbers for cracks, sagging, oil contamination or separated bonding
Check transmission dipstick fluid for burnt smell and dark color; inspect casing for heat discoloration
Parameter Detail
Lift boot carpet and spare wheel cover; inspect boot floor for rust perforation, repair patches or deformation
Inspect both chassis rails from underneath on a lift; check for bends, kinks, repair welds or reinforcement plates
Check front and rear cross-members for proper alignment; look for impact marks, bends or repair evidence
Inspect front and rear crumple zone areas for accordion-type deformation, straightening marks or replacement
Inspect engine bay inner fender panels, shock towers and front rails for impact damage or body shop repairs
Check firewall panel from engine bay side for buckling, ripples, filler or non-factory sealant indicating impact
Inspect floor pan from underneath on a lift; look for non-factory welds, patches or new metal sections
Remove spare wheel; inspect spare wheel well for dents, cracks, repaired metal or shape distortion
Check all structural members from underneath for non-factory welds; compare weld patterns with OEM spots
Inspect front and rear subframe mounting points for cracks, corrosion, loose bolts or impact damage
Check underbody anti-rust/undercoating for completeness; note areas where coating is missing or freshly applied
Inspect entire underbody surface for rust progression: surface, scaling, deep pitting or perforating holes
Parameter Detail
Locate chassis number stampings at multiple points (dashboard, door jamb, engine bay); compare for consistency
Using measuring tape, measure diagonal distances between key frame points; left vs right should match within spec
Inspect front apron panel behind bumper for dents, repair welds, filler or replacement evidence
Check front and rear impact/crash bars for deformation, cracks, welds or non-OEM replacement
Inspect quarter panel joint seams for aftermarket welding, grinding marks or spot-weld irregularity
Inspect rear apron panel behind bumper for impact damage, straightening marks or repair evidence
Run finger along roof-to-pillar weld seams; check for consistent factory spot welds vs irregular patterns
Inspect front shock tower tops for cracks, distortion, wrinkles or weld repairs around mounting points
Check rocker panels/side sills for dents, rust perforation, filler, repair patches or replacement
Inspect structural panel joints for non-factory adhesive, silicone sealant or unusual bonding material
Compare left and right strut tower positions visually and by measurement; should be symmetrical
Inspect VIN plates for re-stamping, tampered rivets, mismatched fonts, sticker overlay or re-engraving
Parameter Detail
Open bonnet fully; check hinge bolt heads for paint crack marks indicating they've been loosened for alignment
Open bonnet to full extent; gas strut should hold bonnet firmly in open position without sagging
Open boot/tailgate; check hinge bolt heads for movement marks and paint disturbance around mounting points
Open boot or tailgate to full height; gas struts should hold it open without slowly dropping
Open each door to various positions; check strap holds door at detent points without excessive play or breakage
Inspect door hinge welds closely; compare with factory pattern for signs of re-welding or hinge replacement
Carefully peel back rubber door and boot seals; check hidden areas for paint overspray on body metal
Run fingertips along all pillar seam lines; feel for cut marks, grinding, non-factory welds or filler
Check panel thickness consistency using magnet; look for non-factory sealant, mismatched bolt heads or fresh paint
Inspect factory sealant lines at panel joints; check for removal marks, re-application or different sealant type
Measure gaps between bonnet-fender, door-fender, door-door and door-quarter on both sides; compare for uniformity
Parameter Detail
Inspect both A-pillars for dents, filler, paint bubbling, repaint evidence or structural repair signs
Inspect both B-pillars for dents, filler, weld repairs, paint inconsistency or structural damage
Inspect both C-pillars for damage, filler application, repaint signs or structural repair evidence
Sight along roof line from front corner to rear; surface should be straight without waves or dips
Check roof rails on both sides for even mounting height, consistent gaps and straight alignment
Inspect roof panel for color shade difference, orange peel texture, masking tape lines or dust in paint
Pour water slowly around sunroof frame perimeter; check inside cabin for any water entry or dripping
Inspect sunroof rubber seal all around for cracks, hardening, compression set or gaps
Parameter Detail
Inspect boot/tailgate rubber weather seal for tears, compression flat spots, gaps or water entry evidence
Check all four door rubber seals for tears, flattening, hardening, peeling or gaps allowing water/wind entry
Inspect windshield perimeter rubber seal for gaps, shrinkage, hardening or signs of water seepage
Parameter Detail
Inspect all painted panels in sunlight for areas where clear coat is peeling, flaking, bubbling or whitening
Compare colors of adjacent panels in direct sunlight; look for shade, tone or metallic flake differences
Systematically count and note size of dents on bonnet, front bumper, front fenders and front doors
Systematically count and note size of dents on rear bumper, tailgate, rear quarters and rear doors
Open all doors; compare door jamb paint color, texture and finish with outer body panels
Examine paint along panel edges where rubber seals sit; interruptions in paint suggest post-factory repaint
Read date code etched on each glass piece (windshield, side, rear); all should match vehicle manufacture year
Inspect both headlight lenses for haziness, yellowing, UV damage, internal cracks or moisture condensation
Check date stamps on headlight housings; manufacturing date should be close to vehicle production date
Inspect front and rear number plates for legibility, fading, cracks, mounting security and reflector condition
Check for OEM factory stickers on door jambs, engine bay sticker, glass etchings and body panels
Examine rubber trims, glass edges, plastic trim and weather seals for traces of paint overspray
Measure panel gaps with feeler gauge at top, middle and bottom of each joint; gaps should be consistent
Inspect rear windshield for cracks, chips, scratches, delamination, seal damage or moisture between layers
Inspect all body panels, wheel arches, door bottoms and lower edges for rust spots or bubbling paint
Count and categorize scratches on front-facing panels: bonnet, front bumper, fenders and front doors
Count and categorize scratches on rear panels: tailgate, rear bumper, quarters and rear doors
Inspect front bumper leading edge, bonnet front and lower windshield for stone chip frequency and depth
Inspect both tail light lenses for cracks, crazing, internal moisture, fading or UV deterioration
Check date stamps on tail light housings; manufacturing date should correspond to vehicle production period
Lift boot carpet and trim; compare paint color and finish underneath with exterior body color
Inspect engine bay inner panels and strut tower paint; compare color and finish with exterior body
Inspect full windshield surface for chips, star breaks, long cracks or stress fractures from edge to edge
Check windshield glass stamp for OEM vs aftermarket brand; look for fresh sealant or uneven fitment gap
Parameter Detail
Place coating thickness gauge at center of bonnet panel; take 3 readings and record average in µm
Place coating thickness gauge on left side of bonnet; take 3 readings and record average in µm
Place coating thickness gauge on right side of bonnet; take 3 readings and record average in µm
Place coating thickness gauge at bottom of left rear quarter panel; record reading in µm
Place coating thickness gauge at mid-section of left rear quarter panel; record reading in µm
Place coating thickness gauge at top of left rear quarter panel; record reading in µm
Place coating thickness gauge at bottom of left front door; record reading in µm
Place coating thickness gauge at mid-section of left front door; record reading in µm
Place coating thickness gauge at top of left front door; record reading in µm
Place coating thickness gauge at bottom of left front fender; record reading in µm
Place coating thickness gauge at mid-section of left front fender; record reading in µm
Place coating thickness gauge at top of left front fender; record reading in µm
Place coating thickness gauge at bottom of left rear door; record reading in µm
Place coating thickness gauge at mid-section of left rear door; record reading in µm
Place coating thickness gauge at top of left rear door; record reading in µm
Place coating thickness gauge at bottom of right rear quarter panel; record reading in µm
Place coating thickness gauge at mid-section of right rear quarter panel; record reading in µm
Place coating thickness gauge at top of right rear quarter panel; record reading in µm
Place coating thickness gauge at bottom of right front door; record reading in µm
Place coating thickness gauge at mid-section of right front door; record reading in µm
Place coating thickness gauge at top of right front door; record reading in µm
Place coating thickness gauge at bottom of right front fender; record reading in µm
Place coating thickness gauge at mid-section of right front fender; record reading in µm
Place coating thickness gauge at top of right front fender; record reading in µm
Place coating thickness gauge at bottom of right rear door; record reading in µm
Place coating thickness gauge at mid-section of right rear door; record reading in µm
Place coating thickness gauge at top of right rear door; record reading in µm
Place coating thickness gauge at center of roof panel; record reading in µm
Place coating thickness gauge at front area of roof panel; record reading in µm
Place coating thickness gauge at rear area of roof panel; record reading in µm
Parameter Detail
Take coating thickness reading on bonnet using paint gauge; record single representative value in µm
Inspect bonnet for repaint indicators: color mismatch, orange peel texture, masking lines or fresh sealant
Check bonnet for replacement signs: non-factory bolts, missing OEM stickers, VIN label absence or alignment issues
Run magnet across front bumper surface; check for body filler. High micron readings indicate filler buildup
Take coating thickness reading on front bumper using paint gauge; record value in µm
Inspect front bumper for repaint signs: color variation, overspray on grille/lights, fresh clips or masking residue
Measure left front door gaps at top, middle and bottom against adjacent panels; check flush alignment
Take coating thickness reading on left front door using paint gauge; record value in µm
Inspect left front door for repaint signs: color mismatch with jamb, orange peel, dust nibs or tape lines
Measure left rear door gaps at top, middle and bottom against adjacent panels; check flush alignment
Take coating thickness reading on left rear door using paint gauge; record value in µm
Inspect left rear door for repaint signs: color shade difference, texture change or sealant disturbance
Take coating thickness reading on left front fender using paint gauge; record value in µm
Inspect left front fender for repaint signs: color variation, overspray, fresh bolts or masking evidence
Check left front fender for replacement: non-factory bolts, missing liner clips, gap inconsistency or fresh paint
Take coating thickness reading on left rear quarter panel using paint gauge; record value in µm
Measure right front door gaps at top, middle and bottom against adjacent panels; check flush alignment
Take coating thickness reading on right front door using paint gauge; record value in µm
Inspect right front door for repaint signs: color mismatch with jamb, texture change or tape line evidence
Measure right rear door gaps at top, middle and bottom against adjacent panels; check flush alignment
Take coating thickness reading on right rear door using paint gauge; record value in µm
Inspect right rear door for repaint signs: color shade difference, orange peel change or sealant disturbance
Inspect rear bumper for repaint signs: color mismatch, overspray on lights, fresh clips or masking residue
Take coating thickness reading on right front fender using paint gauge; record value in µm
Inspect right front fender for repaint signs: color variation, overspray, fresh bolts or masking evidence
Check right front fender for replacement: non-factory bolts, missing clips, gap inconsistency or fresh paint
Take coating thickness reading on right rear quarter panel using paint gauge; record value in µm
Take coating thickness reading on roof panel using paint gauge; record value in µm
Inspect roof for repaint signs: color shade difference from pillars, texture change or masking evidence at edges
Take coating thickness reading on tailgate/boot lid using paint gauge; record value in µm
Inspect tailgate for repaint signs: color mismatch, orange peel, overspray on badge or sealant disturbance
Parameter Detail
Apply firm braking on safe dry surface at 40 km/h; ABS pedal should pulse and vehicle should track straight
Visually inspect brake disc surface through wheel spokes or with wheel removed; check for grooves, lips or cracks
Inspect brake calipers, hose connections, lines and master cylinder for any fluid leaks or wet spots
Inspect all metal brake lines running along underbody for surface rust, deep corrosion or flaking
Inspect front-left brake pad thickness through caliper window or by removing wheel; measure remaining material in mm
Inspect front-right brake pad thickness through caliper window or by removing wheel; measure remaining material in mm
Inspect rear-left brake pad thickness through caliper window or by removing wheel; measure remaining material in mm
Inspect rear-right brake pad thickness through caliper window or by removing wheel; measure remaining material in mm
Pull handbrake lever fully; vehicle should hold firm on moderate incline without any rolling or creeping
Parameter Detail
Inspect anti-roll bar end links for worn bushes, play or clunking when rocked by hand
With wheel lifted off ground, pry under ball joint with lever; check for vertical play or clunking
Inspect lower and upper control arm rubber bushes for visible cracking, perishing, bulging or oil contamination
Visually inspect front shock absorber bodies and shafts for oil wetness, film or active dripping
Visually inspect rear shock absorber bodies and shafts for oil wetness, film or active dripping
Turn steering wheel slowly lock to lock; listen for clicks, clunks, creaking or grinding from steering column
With engine running, gently rock steering wheel left-right; measure free play before front wheels begin to move
Inspect steering rack rubber boots for tears and oil leaks; check rack housing and tie rod seals for fluid
Drive slowly over speed bumps and rough patches; listen for clunks, rattles, squeaks or thuds from suspension
Push each corner of vehicle down firmly and release; body should bounce once and quickly settle (not continue bouncing)
Drive on straight flat road and briefly release steering; vehicle should track straight without pulling to either side
Drive at 40-60 km/h; listen for humming or droning noise that changes pitch when steering is turned slightly
Parameter Detail
Inspect all alloy wheel rims closely for kerb rash, scuff marks, cracks, bends or signs of repair/welding
Remove spare wheel from vehicle; check tread depth, sidewall condition, age and inflate to correct pressure
Read DOT code on each tyre sidewall; last 4 digits indicate manufacturing week and year
Measure all four tyre pressures using calibrated gauge; compare readings with door jamb or manual specification
Measure front-left tyre tread depth at 3 points across the tread width using depth gauge; record minimum value
Measure front-right tyre tread depth at 3 points across the tread width using depth gauge; record minimum value
Measure rear-left tyre tread depth at 3 points across the tread width using depth gauge; record minimum value
Measure rear-right tyre tread depth at 3 points across the tread width using depth gauge; record minimum value
Inspect all tyre wear patterns; inner/outer edge wear, center wear, cupping or feathering indicates alignment or suspension issues
Parameter Detail
Switch AC on and off; listen at compressor area under bonnet for rattling, squealing or knocking
Run AC on max cool with recirculation for 5 minutes; measure vent temperature drop using thermometer
Test blower/fan on all speed settings; should operate smoothly at each speed without squealing or rattling
Test central lock from key fob, driver door switch and key; all four doors should lock and unlock simultaneously
Pull fuel flap release lever or press button; fuel flap should pop open cleanly and close securely
Press horn button; sound should be clear, loud and consistent without stuttering or weak output
Power on infotainment system; test radio reception, Bluetooth pairing, navigation, USB media and speakers
Engage reverse and approach obstacle slowly; parking sensors should beep with increasing frequency as distance closes
Test front-left power window up and down through full travel; check auto-up/down function and anti-pinch
Test front-right power window up and down through full travel; check auto-up/down function and operation from driver switch
Test rear-left power window up and down through full travel; check child lock disable from driver controls
Test rear-right power window up and down through full travel; check child lock disable from driver controls
Test all key fob buttons from 10 meters: lock, unlock, boot release; verify indicator flash confirmation
Engage reverse gear; rear camera should display clear image with parking guidelines on infotainment screen
Open sunroof fully and close; test tilt function and ensure smooth operation without binding or noise
Tap and swipe across different areas of touchscreen; all zones should register touch input accurately without lag
Parameter Detail
Press brake pedal; verify all brake lights illuminate including high-mount third brake light; check brightness
Switch on front and rear fog lamps separately; verify both illuminate correctly and turn off when switched
Press hazard warning switch; all four indicators and dashboard light should flash simultaneously at even rate
Test low beam and high beam headlights; verify both sides illuminate evenly with proper beam pattern and alignment
Test left and right turn indicators; check front, rear, side repeater and mirror indicators all flash in sync
Engage reverse gear; verify both white reverse lights illuminate at rear of vehicle
Parameter Detail
Test electric adjustment for both ORVMs using joystick/buttons; mirror should move in all four directions smoothly
Inspect left ORVM glass and housing for cracks, chips, scratches, fading, broken cover or loose mounting
Inspect right ORVM glass and housing for cracks, chips, scratches, fading, broken cover or loose mounting
Activate electric mirror fold button; both ORVMs should fold inward and unfold smoothly without grinding
Parameter Detail
With engine running at idle, measure voltage across battery terminals; should read between 13.8V and 14.4V
Connect electronic battery tester to terminals; read cold cranking amps (CCA) and overall health percentage
Locate manufacture date label on battery; note manufacturing month and year to assess battery age
Parameter Detail
Plug 12V tester or phone charger into accessory socket; verify power output in both ignition ON and ACC positions
Turn ignition to ON; ABS warning light should illuminate for self-test then turn off within a few seconds
Turn ignition to ON; airbag/SRS warning light should illuminate briefly for self-test then extinguish
Attempt to start engine without correct key/transponder; immobilizer should prevent engine from starting
Turn ignition to ON; observe all dashboard warning lights during self-test. All should illuminate then turn off
Test all interior lights: dome, map/reading, foot well, glove box vanity mirror and boot/trunk light
Plug USB cable into each port; verify device charging and data transfer functionality where applicable
Parameter Detail
Inspect front wiper blades by lifting arms; check rubber for cracks, splits, hardening or torn edges
Switch on rear demister/defogger; touch rear glass after 2-3 minutes to verify heating elements are warming
Inspect rear wiper blade by lifting arm; check rubber edge for wear, cracking, curling or poor glass contact
Activate windshield washer; jets should spray evenly and accurately onto windshield glass with adequate pressure
Test front wipers on all speeds: low, high and intermittent; blades should sweep smoothly without juddering or streaking
Parameter Detail
Inspect steering wheel centre, dashboard panels and pillar trim for airbag deployment evidence or replacement signs
Inspect boot lining, carpet and side trim for tears, stains, moisture damage, mismatch or aftermarket replacement
Sit inside closed cabin; sniff for musty, mildew or damp odors that indicate previous flooding or water damage
Press firmly on floor carpets in all foot wells and under front seats; check for any dampness or water retention
Inspect full dashboard surface for cracks, warping, discoloration or heat damage especially above airbag area
Check all four door inner trim panels for scratches, scuffs, loose or broken clips, torn fabric or cracked plastic
Compare brake and clutch pedal rubber wear pattern with claimed odometer reading; heavy wear on low-km car is suspicious
Inspect headliner fabric across entire roof; check for sagging, water stains, tears or signs of re-gluing
Firmly rock driver and passenger seats; check mounting bolts, seat rails and frame for looseness or damage
Pull each seatbelt fully out and release; buckle should click securely and belt should lock during sharp pull test
Pull each seatbelt out fully then release; retractor should pull belt back smoothly without sticking or bunching
Check steering wheel leather or rubber for wear, shine and smoothness; compare wear level against claimed odometer reading
Parameter Detail
Drive over rough road surface; listen carefully for rattles, creaks or squeaks from dashboard, doors or trim panels
Engage child safety locks on both rear doors; attempt to open from inside—doors should not open from interior handle
Check for fire extinguisher in cabin; verify it is present, properly mounted and within expiry date
Locate ISOFIX anchor points between rear seat base and backrest; check metal anchors are accessible and undamaged
Remove vehicle jack from storage; inspect for rust, completeness of parts and test lifting mechanism operation
Count all keys and key fobs provided by seller; full set typically means 2 or more keys
Pull rear seat fold release lever; seat back should fold forward and return to upright position with secure latch
Check for reflective warning triangle in boot; verify it is present and in usable condition
Test all seat adjustment functions: forward/back slide, backrest recline, height adjustment and lumbar support
Check boot for complete spare wheel kit: spare tyre, jack, wheel wrench, jack handle and tow hook
Inspect tool kit pouch for completeness: wheel wrench, screwdriver, jack handle and any vehicle-specific tools
Parameter Detail
Physically locate chassis number stamping on vehicle body; compare character-by-character with RC book entry
Locate engine number stamping on engine block; compare character-by-character with RC book entry
Check FASTag on windshield; verify it is linked to the correct vehicle registration number via NHAI portal
Check RC book for hypothecation endorsement; verify loan or lien status with bank/NBFC and RTO records
Check motor insurance policy for validity dates, vehicle details match, coverage type and claim history
If hypothecation exists on RC, verify that No Objection Certificate from financier has been obtained
Check insurance papers for No Claim Bonus status, accumulated discount percentage and transfer eligibility
Count ownership transfers recorded on RC book; note each transfer date and verify sequence
Check for pending traffic challans via Parivahan portal or state transport website using registration number
Verify Pollution Under Control certificate: validity date, emission readings and matching registration details
Examine original RC book: check print quality, lamination integrity, hologram, watermarks for authenticity
Compare RC registration state with vehicle current usage state; interstate vehicles may have transfer implications
Parameter Detail
Access insurance claim records for this vehicle; check for accident claims, amounts and repair descriptions
Verify if a duplicate/spare key is available and physically test it starts the engine and operates locks
Cross-check vehicle VIN against insurance flood damage databases and natural disaster claim records
Check manufacturer website or dealer database for any pending or incomplete safety recall campaigns
Review physical service book for authorized dealer stamps, service dates and consistent interval pattern
Compare service dates in service book; identify gaps exceeding manufacturer recommended service intervals
Cross-check vehicle VIN against insurance databases for any previous total-loss or constructive-loss declaration
Check warranty status through manufacturer dealer or online portal; note remaining coverage period and terms
Parameter Detail
Take corners and roundabouts at moderate speed; assess how much the body leans and how quickly it recovers
Drive at 80-100 km/h with windows closed; assess overall cabin noise from wind, tyres and engine
Accelerate from 60 to 100 km/h (overtaking simulation); assess engine power delivery and throttle response
Stop on moderate incline; engage parking brake and release foot brake; vehicle must hold position firmly
Reverse in a straight line and then a turn; assess rear visibility, smoothness and confidence in maneuver
At steady 60 km/h and 100 km/h, compare speedometer reading with GPS speed app to check accuracy
On straight flat road, briefly loosen grip on steering; vehicle should maintain straight line without pulling or drifting
Drive through congested stop-and-go traffic for 10+ minutes; assess gear change smoothness and low-speed behavior
Parameter Detail
Drive uphill or accelerate hard with AC on full; AC should maintain cooling without significant performance drop
From standstill, press accelerator firmly; note any delay or flat spot before power is delivered to wheels
Apply firm braking from 60 km/h; vehicle should stop in a straight line without pulling to either side
Set cruise control at highway speed; verify it maintains set speed, accelerates on resume and cancels on brake
Monitor engine temperature gauge during extended 15+ minute drive; needle should stay stable in normal zone
Accelerate steadily through gear changes; each upshift and downshift should happen promptly without hesitation or jerk
Start from standstill on incline; assess hill-hold assist engagement and power delivery without excessive rollback
Drive at 80-100 km/h on smooth road; feel steering wheel for vibration, shimmy or wobble through hands
Drive at 100 km/h on straight highway; vehicle should maintain lane without constant steering corrections needed
Drive over speed bumps, potholes and rough patches at moderate speed; listen for thuds, clunks or rattles from suspension
Parameter Detail
Brake hard on safe dry surface; ABS should activate with firm pulsating pedal feel and vehicle tracking straight
While cruising at 60 km/h, floor the accelerator; automatic transmission should kickdown promptly for overtaking power
In 3rd or 4th gear at 30-40 km/h, accelerate hard; engine RPM should rise proportionally with vehicle speed gain
Perform emergency stop from 60 km/h on safe road; assess stopping distance, pedal feel and vehicle stability
Drive at 100+ km/h on highway; assess overall stability, vibration, wind sensitivity and driver confidence level
Turn steering wheel to full lock then release; steering should self-center smoothly as vehicle moves forward
Accelerate on loose or wet surface; traction control should intervene by cutting power or braking spinning wheel
